DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis # 1 . Supervised exercise rehabilitation result great increase exercise performance , peripheral vascular function , health-related quality life compare attention-control group . Hypothesis # 2 . The change peripheral vascular function predictive improve exercise performance follow supervised exercise program .
DOC.brief_title: Exercise Women With Peripheral Arterial Disease
DOC.criteria: woman 60 year age older positive history intermittent claudication assess San Diego Claudication Questionnaire exercise limit intermittent claudication screen treadmill test use Gardner protocol ankle/brachial index ( ABI ) < 0.90 rest < 0.73 immediately follow treadmill exercise test least one year past menopause absence PAD ( peripheral artery disease ) asymptomatic PAD ( Fontaine stage I ) rest pain due PAD ( Fontaine stage III ) tissue loss due PAD ( Fontaine stage IV ) medical condition contraindicative exercise accord American College Sports Medicine ( e.g. , acute myocardial infarction , unstable angina , etc . ) use medication indicate treatment intermittent claudication ( cilostazol pentoxifylline ) initiate within three month prior investigation ) cognitive dysfunction ( minimental state examination score < 24 ) active cancer , renal disease , liver disease calf skin fold measurement > 50 mm , potential interference light path nearinfrared spectroscopy probe penetrate subcutaneous tissue pulse arterial oxygen saturation index finger < 95 % potential deleterious effect calf muscle StO2 poor pulmonary gas exchange
